letters.description: Cultivate mindful presence and understand the client's perspective on mortality, values, and wishes.
Explore client's fears, beliefs, and provide education on end-of-life options, practicalities, and grief processes.
Facilitate the creation of advance care plans, connect with resources, and advocate for the client's desired end-of-life experience.
Provide emotional, spiritual, and practical support to enhance comfort, foster meaningful connections, and promote peace of mind.
Embrace the dying process, support ongoing evolution of plans, and facilitate closure for the client and loved ones.
